title: Introducing: Howlet
body:
‘young and husbandless, alternating between the mindset electronic and body acoustic’

**Howlet**, the project of Illinois’ **Lydia Jordan Smith** may well have just released one of the years most intoxicating EPs so far.

**_Afraidarck_**, a collection of four tracks that almost sound as if they’re recorded live direct to tape, is devastating in it’s beauty. With a vocal that feels almost bodiless, and a unique manner of composing and looping, this release at times become intimidating; hiding out in the sparse, eerie corners that she retreats into. Comparison wise, there’s touches of **Grimes** in the other-worldly, introverted feel to each track, and hints of **Blue Hawaii** in the tender, brooding production. As much of an experience as a ‘release’, it demands repeated listens. Check out the full EP below, including personal highlight Hide, and a live performance of _Afloat_ underneath that.
